page.title: 15PRIMARY EDUCATION
page.content: The two primary schools we visited were Collingham and East Keswick. Most children like school because of playtimes. They do P.E., English and Scottish Maths. Scottish Maths is a maths scheme that goes from the beginning to the end of primary school. Pupils do topics in Reading and Artwork. Outside the classroom they plant seeds and go swimming. the class numbers vary from 20 to 30 pupils per class. Pupils don't like Writing. They like Reading and Artwork. Special events include Christmas parties, coffee mornings, Easter egg competitions, fetes, jumble sales, maypole dancing, pig roasts and strawberry fayre.
